Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Material: MOTHER OF PEARL; SHELL (OSTRICH EGG); ENAMEL
Name: Bracelet
Description: This piece of jewellery was reassembled using ornaments found in a C-Group grave: in the middle a rectangular mother of pearl tablet, flanked by two slightly smaller ones. They are pierced both at the top and at the bottom and are separated by disc-shaped beads made of ostrich eggshell and blue enamel beads. The top and bottom rows are joined at the extremities to form only a single row. The materials and composition are typical of the C-Group.
